<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?><rss version="2.0" xml:base="http://www.theweek.co.uk/feeds/all" xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:v="http://rdf.data-vocabulary.org/#" xmlns:content="http://purl.org/rss/1.0/modules/content/" xmlns:foaf="http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/" xmlns:og="http://ogp.me/ns#" xmlns:rdfs="http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#" xmlns:sioc="http://rdfs.org/sioc/ns#" xmlns:sioct="http://rdfs.org/sioc/types#" xmlns:skos="http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#" xmlns:schema="http://schema.org/">

          <item>
    <title>Ten Things You Need to Know Today: Friday 13 May 2016</title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/daily-briefing/72583/ten-things-you-need-to-know-today-friday-13-may-2016</link>
    <description><div class="field-collection-container clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-stories field-type-field-collection field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-stories/23504" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Major: Leave campaign &#039;morphing into Ukip&#039;</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Former PM Sir John Major will say today that the leaders of the Leave campaign are &quot;morphing into Ukip&quot; by turning to &quot;their default position - immigration&quot; as their other arguments &quot;implode one by one&quot;. He will say that using arguments around immigration is &quot;dangerous&quot; and could &quot;open up long-term divisions in our society&quot;.</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-stories/23505" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Migrant crisis: EU med mission &#039;is failing&#039;</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">The House of Lords EU committee has warned that the EU&#039;s naval mission to tackle people-smuggling in the central Mediterranean is failing and does not &quot;in any meaningful way&quot; disrupt the flow of migrants in dangerous boats. The mission has destroyed wooden boats but migrants are instead making the crossing in rubber dinghies.</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-stories/23506" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">No bias: Zuckerberg to talk to conservatives</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Facebook boss Mark Zuckerberg is to hold talks with senior US conservatives as he repeats his denial that the social network is politically biased. It has been claimed that the company&#039;s &quot;news curators&quot; routinely suppress stories of interest to conservative readers and artificially inject news stories into the site&#039;s list of trending topics.</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-stories/23507" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Hezbollah&#039;s &#039;ghost&#039; commander killed in Damascus</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Hezbollah says its military commander, Mustafa Badreddine, has been killed in a &quot;major explosion&quot; at Damascus airport in Syria, which media reports say could be the work of the Israeli military. Dubbed the &#039;untraceable ghost&#039;, Badreddine has fought Israel for decades. Hezbollah is classed as a terrorist organisation by Israel and the US. </div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-stories/23508" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Temer takes over Brazil after Rousseff exit</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">The suspension of Brazilian president Dilma Rousseff, who says the claim she manipulated figures to be re-elected has been trumped-up by her political opponents, has led her former deputy Michel Temer to take over as interim leader. Temer has unveiled a &quot;conspicuously&quot; all-male and all-white cabinet to lead the diverse nation, says The Guardian.</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-stories/23509" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">RAF jets intercept &#039;aggressive&#039; Russian planes</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">RAF typhoon jets have been scrambled for the first time since their deployment to Estonia in April on a four-month policing mission. The typhoons intercepted three Russian aircraft which were approaching Estonian airspace and were &quot;unresponsive&quot;. Defence secretary Michael Fallon described it as an &quot;act of Russian aggression&quot;.</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-stories/23510" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">US demotes navy commander after Iran incident</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">The US Navy commander whose squadron was briefly detained by Iran in January, after they entered Iranian waters when their boat broke down, has been demoted. The Navy said Cmdr Eric Rasch had been complacent and failed to provide effective leadership. The incident was resolved after intensive diplomacy by John Kerry.</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-stories/23511" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Stone Roses release first single for 21 years</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">The Stone Roses have released a single, All For One, their first new music for 21 years. The song&#039;s &quot;fluid guitar riff and optimistic lyrics pick up exactly where the band left off in 1995&quot;, says the BBC. The release was announced on the band&#039;s Twitter feed with a link to iTunes. Within minutes, the site crashed, says Sky News.</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-stories/23512" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Queen delighted to win £50 Tesco voucher</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">The Queen has been pictured laughing over a £50 voucher from Tesco won by her horse Barber&#039;s Shop at a horse show in Windsor. The Guardian points out that the royal family&#039;s food bill is £25,000 per week while the Daily Telegraph says the voucher is not &quot;life-changing&quot; for a &quot;woman with a personal fortune of £277m&quot;.</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-stories/23513" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Briefing: Will Scotland swing the EU vote?</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Voters in Scotland could tip the balance of the European Union referendum result, after a poll revealed that more than three-quarters of Scots oppose Brexit. A Survation survey commissioned by the Daily Record puts support for remaining in the EU at 76 per cent among Scottish voters. &quot;These figures are encouraging,&quot; a spokesman for Scotland Stronger in Europe told the newspaper. Scots could have &quot;a decisive impact on the result UK-wide&quot;, he said
</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-reference field-type-node-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/eu-referendum/65461/eu-referendum-poll-will-scotland-swing-the-vote">EU referendum poll: Will Scotland swing the vote?</a></div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>    </div></div></div></description>
     <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 07:04:22 +0000</pubDate>
 <dc:creator>Tim Edwards</dc:creator>
 <guid isPermaLink="false">72583 at http://www.theweek.co.uk</guid>
  </item>
  <item>
    <title>Friday May 13 2016</title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/am/friday-may-13-2016</link>
    <description><p class="short-teaser">
Company news, markets and financial talking points, available from 8am Monday to Friday</p>
<div class="field-collection-container clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-items field-type-field-collection field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-items clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-items/23497" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-item-title field-type-text field-label-hidden">Carney warns Brexit could lead to recession</div><div class="field field-name-field-item-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> The Bank of England governor Mark Carney has warned that the risks of leaving the European Union "could possibly include a technical recession". Carney has been criticised for making the statement but a spokesman said the Bank had "a duty" to make its judgements known. David Cameron added that the warning amounted to "a very clear message" of the dangers of Brexit. </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-items clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-items/23498" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-item-title field-type-text field-label-hidden">Apple invests in Chinese Uber rival</div><div class="field field-name-field-item-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> Apple has invested $1bn (£693m) in Didi Chuxing, a Chinese car-hailing app. Didi Chuxing, which has a greater market share than US rival Uber in China, said the move represented the single largest investment in its history. Tim Cook, chief executive of Apple, said that the investment would help his company to better understand the Chinese market. </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-items clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-items/23499" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-item-title field-type-text field-label-hidden">PPI victims 'should have got £5bn more', say MPs</div><div class="field field-name-field-item-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> PPI victims should have got an extra £5bn, a group of MPs has said. The Public Accounts Committee warned of "serious risks" of further bad practice in the sector, which is continuing to count the cost of PPI and other scandals. Chair, Meg Hillier, said: "The widespread mis-selling of PPI is a vivid demonstration of the risks facing consumers in the financial services market.” </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-items clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-items/23500" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-item-title field-type-text field-label-hidden">Booze consumption falls for first time this century</div><div class="field field-name-field-item-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> Global alcohol consumption has declined for the first time since the turn of century, reports the Daily Telegraph. Amid a slump in oil and commodity prices, currency volatility and economic turmoil in China, the volume of alcoholic beverages drunk in 2015 fell by 0.7% to 248bn litres as the worldwide population sank 1.7bn litres less than the year before, according to Euromonitor International. </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-items clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-items/23501" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-item-title field-type-text field-label-hidden">Boss's baseball bat bashes Barclays banker's bonce</div><div class="field field-name-field-item-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> A former Barclays banker accused of rigging the Libor rate was “whacked across the back of the head” with a 12-inch baseball bat by his boss, a court heard. Jonathan Mathew, who is dyslexic and partially deaf, alleged what The Times calls “Wolf of Wall Street-style antics” by his boss, Peter Johnson, 62, which left him feeling “humiliated”. The trial continues. </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-items clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-items/23502" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-item-title field-type-text field-label-hidden">Quote of the day… But how much tax do the luvvies pay?</div><div class="field field-name-field-item-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> “And while the ‘luvvies’ like to bang on about how much tax we should all pay , 'arts, recreation and entertainment' only chips in 1.8% (maybe all those actors have very good accountants).” Matthew Lynn <a href="http://www.telegraph.co.uk/business/2016/05/12/its-time-to-put-a-stop-to-all-the-banker-bashing/" target="_blank">says</a> it’s “time to put a stop to all the banker bashing”.</p>
<p>  </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-items clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-items/23503" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-item-title field-type-text field-label-hidden">THE NUMBERS... AT 0743 GMT</div><div class="field field-name-field-item-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> FTSE-100: down -0.95 to 6104.19<br />
Dow Jones: up +0.05 to 17711.12<br />
Dax: down -1.13 to 9862.12<br />
Cac-40: down -0.54 to 4293.27<br />
Nikkei: down -1.01 to 16477.88<br />
Hang Seng: down -1.30 to 19656.73<br />
US dollar: buys €0.88100 and £0.69350<br />
Sterling: buys $1.44170 and €1.27040<br />
Oil: $47.93 up +0.7 </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>    </div></div></div></description>
     <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 06:53:33 +0000</pubDate>
 <dc:creator>Tim Edwards</dc:creator>

  </item>
  <item>
    <title>Neart na Gaoithe wind farm failure brings scrutiny on subsidy schemes</title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/72565/neart-na-gaoithe-wind-farm-failure-brings-scrutiny-on-subsidy-schemes</link>
    <description><div class="primary-image">
      <div id="file-94820" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg file-default">
  
  
  <div class="content">    <img src="http://cdn2.theweek.co.uk/sites/theweek/files/styles/article_main_image/public/2016/05/160512-wind-farm.jpg?itok=j6gVNYTH" alt="wind farm" title="wind farm" /><div class="field field-name-field-file-description field-type-text-long field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Description&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> <span> </span> </p>
</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-credits field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Credits&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Jeff J Mitchell/Getty Images</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-alt-text field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Alt Text&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">wind farm</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>  </div>
<p class="short-teaser">
Delays in getting a verdict cause UK government body to scupper Holyrood-approved project</p>
<span class="field field-name-field-article-type field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">
      <span class="field-item even"><a href="/one-minute-read">One-Minute Read</a></span>
  </span><div class="field field-name-field-published-date field-type-datetime field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Thursday, May 12, 2016 - 4:16pm</span></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-body">
            <div class="field-item even">
        <p> Questions are being raised over the complex management of renewable energy subsidy schemes, after a major offshore wind farm off the coast of Fife was effectively scuppered.</p>
<!--wysiwyg_see-related_plugin--><p>The 64-turbine Neart na Gaoithe project, which, the <a href="http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/05/12/birds-scupper-2bn-offshore-wind-farm/" target="_blank">Daily Telegraph</a> notes, was one of only two offshore developments to win a government subsidy contract last year, has been thrown into jeopardy after its contract was terminated by the arms-length body that manages them on behalf of the UK government.</p>
<p>The Low Carbon Contracts Company (LCCC) pulled the subsidies after a 26 March deadline to invest £200m into the £2bn development was missed.</p>
<p>This in turn occurred because a judge delayed a verdict on a judicial review launched by the RSPB challenging the plans over an apparent threat to the gannets at the nearby Bass Rock colony, the largest in the world. </p>
<p>It means a project that received planning approval from the Scottish government has been undermined by the decision of a body that reports into the Department of Energy and Climate Change in Westminster.</p>
<p>In parliament this week, Andrea Leadsom, the energy minister, said the decision was one for the independent LCCC and not the UK government. </p>
<p>Ironically, RSPB Scotland itself told the <a href="http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/d2f40934-1792-11e6-b8d5-4c1fcdbe169f.html#axzz488w9oNGh" target="_blank">Financial Times</a> that the issue highlighted that there could be "better join up" between the "Edinburgh government's planning process and the management of wind farm financing by LCCC and the UK government".</p>
<p>Global wind and solar developer Mainstream Renewable Power, the company behind Neart na Gaoithe, said the project is still ready to start and the financial backer remain committed, adding that it "strongly disputes the validity of the termination notice".</p>
<p>The company remains in arbitration with LCCC but unless the decision is fully reversed, the subsidies will no longer be available and the project will be effectively killed off, even if the judge rules in its favour.</p>
<p>The Telegraph says the decision could help the government by freeing up "some cash in the government's budget for renewable energy subsidies, which had been overspent". But the FT says it could also undermine "efforts to meet UK and Scottish carbon emissions targets".</p>
<p>Wind power has become a major part of Scotland's renewable energy landscape. <a href="http://www.scotsman.com/news/wind-power-provides-electricity-for-75-per-cent-of-scots-homes-1-4116969" target="_blank">The Scotsman</a> reports that turbines provided enough electricity to power 75 per cent of homes north of the border in April, well ahead of a target of 50 per cent. </p>
          </div>
      </div><div class="field field-name-field-category-secondary field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/economy">Economy</a></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-tags field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/tags/renewable-energy">Renewable energy</a></div>    </div></div></description>
     <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 15:16:19 +0000</pubDate>
 <dc:creator>Rebecca Gillie</dc:creator>

  <item>
    <title>Tony Cozier, the voice and conscience of West Indies cricket, dies</title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/72563/tony-cozier-the-voice-and-conscience-of-west-indies-cricket-dies</link>
    <description><div class="primary-image">
      <div id="file-94819" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg file-default">
  
  
  <div class="content">    <img src="http://cdn1.theweek.co.uk/sites/theweek/files/styles/article_main_image/public/2016/05/160512-cozier.jpg?itok=HfqqfC4Q" alt="Tony Cozier" title="Tony Cozier" /><div class="field field-name-field-file-credits field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Credits&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Tom Shaw/Getty Images</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-alt-text field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Alt Text&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Tony Cozier</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>  </div>
<p class="short-teaser">
Commentator brought a flavour of the Caribbean to the game as he chronicled the rise and fall of a cricketing dynasty</p>
<span class="field field-name-field-article-type field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">
      <span class="field-item even"><a href="/profile">Profile</a></span>
  </span><div class="field field-name-field-published-date field-type-datetime field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Thursday, May 12, 2016 - 4:06pm</span></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-related-articles field-type-node-reference field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">See related&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">
<div class="node node-article node-promoted odd node-inline-teaser">

          <h5><span><a href="/world-t20/71155/where-now-for-west-indies-cricket-after-world-t20-triumph">Where now for West Indies cricket after World T20 triumph?</a></span></h5>
      
  
  <div class="content">

    
    
      </div>

  
</div>
</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-body">
            <div class="field-item even">
        <p> The cricket world has been mourning the death of commentator Tony Cozier, who has died at the age of 75.</p>
<p>The Barbados-born journalist had one of the most recognisable voices in the game and covered the West Indies for more than 50 years, seeing the team rise to the summit of the game before falling back alarmingly.</p>
<p>Cozier began his career in 1958, when he was in his teens, and first appeared on the BBC's Test Match Special in 1966. He made his final appearance on the show last year.</p>
<p>"He had a voice which instantly transported you from wherever you were in the world to the sun-drenched beaches of Barbados," TMS producer Adam Mountford told the <a href="http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/cricket/36254041" target="_blank">BBC</a>, while Jonathan Agnew described him as "one of the finest writers and broadcasters in the game".</p>
<p>The Barbadian commentator also brought a different perspective to the game, writes Vaneisa Baksh on <a href="http://www.espncricinfo.com/magazine/content/story/1012705.html" target="_blank">Cricinfo</a>. "When he took the microphone and the broadcast chair, he brought a West Indian voice to cricket," she says. "He could weave history, stats jokes and island titbits into ball-by-ball commentary seamlessly, so that for the first time, a Caribbean perspective made it to the airwaves."</p>
<p>Cozier and his "Bajan lilt" so embodied the West Indies that it came as a surprise to many to discover he was white, says Scyld Berry of the <a href="http://www.telegraph.co.uk/cricket/2016/05/11/tony-cozier--steered-right-path-between-the-dryness-of-australia/" target="_blank">Daily Telegraph</a>, adding that he was "descended from the Scottish labourers who emigrated to the island in the seventeenth century".</p>
<p>The commentator did more than simply observe the West Indian game, says Agnew:  "Throughout his career, Cozier had to tread the tense tightrope of Caribbean politics, where even the slightest negative observation of a player's performance can provoke a furious nationalistic backlash.</p>
<p>"He withstood this stoically and determinedly, remaining a strong critic of the West Indies Cricket Board's lack of organisation and outlook."</p>
<p>Cozier became the "conscience" of West Indian cricket, agrees Berry of the Telegraph. "Right up to his death, he gave the West Indian board hell for squandering the money and legacy that it had inherited."</p>
<p>And he held them to account to the very last, writes Mike Selvey in <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/sport/2016/may/11/tony-cozier-west-indies-commentator-dies-cricket" target="_blank">The Guardian</a>. "The decline of the game around the islands left him not just saddened but angry."</p>
<p>But his determination to defend the game did not interfere with his enjoyment of life. "His stories of West Indies cricket were legendary: as a summariser to his radio commentary... Best of all was when the rum or Banks beer flowed at his beautiful ramshackle beach house on the east coast of Barbados."</p>
<p>His "beach parties were legendary, unmissable events on any island visit", says Selvey. </p>
          </div>
      </div><div class="field field-name-field-tags field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/tags/west-indies">West Indies</a></div>    </div></div></description>

  <item>
    <title>Frank de Boer favourite to replace Roberto Martinez</title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/everton/72558/frank-de-boer-favourite-to-replace-roberto-martinez</link>
    <description><div class="primary-image">
      <div id="file-94809" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg file-default">
  
  
  <div class="content">    <img src="http://cdn1.theweek.co.uk/sites/theweek/files/styles/article_main_image/public/2016/05/160512-martinez.jpg?itok=pg34V-C8" alt="Roberto Martinez" title="Roberto Martinez" /><div class="field field-name-field-file-description field-type-text-long field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Description&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> Roberto Martinez was sacked with just one more game to play this season </p>
</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-credits field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Credits&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Stu Forster/Getty Images</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-alt-text field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Alt Text&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Roberto Martinez</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>  </div>
<p class="short-teaser">
Everton manager sacked after three seasons of underachievement as relationship with fans and players collapses</p>
<span class="field field-name-field-article-type field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">
      <span class="field-item even"><a href="/reaction">Reaction</a></span>
  </span><div class="field field-name-field-published-date field-type-datetime field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Thursday, May 12, 2016 - 3:31pm</span></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-body">
            <div class="field-item even">
        <p> The ramifications of Sunderland's win over Everton at the Stadium of Light have been felt across the Premier League. </p>
<p>Not only did the result send Norwich and Newcastle out of the Premier League, it also proved to be the last straw for Everton, who have sacked manager Roberto Martinez with one game left to go this season.</p>
<p>The move at least avoids the embarrassment of seeing Martinez heckled at the club's end-of-season awards dinner in Liverpool tonight and the prospect of more unrest during the final game of the season at home against Norwich.</p>
<p>With the Canaries already relegated and Everton now managerless and smarting after another season of underachievement, the atmosphere at Goodison Park is likely to be rather flat.</p>
<p>"It was a matter of when rather than if," says the <a href="http://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2016/05/12/everton-sack-roberto-martinez---latest-reaction/" target="_blank">Daily Telegraph</a>. "Everton have picked up only four points in the Premier League since March 5 and their 3-0 defeat to Sunderland stretched their dismal run of form to just one win in ten matches in all competitions."</p>
<p>Everton have won only 22 league matches in the past two Premier League seasons and have failed to deliver on the promise of Martinez's first season in charge, when they accrued their highest-ever Premier League points tally of 72.</p>
<p>Getting rid of the Spaniard is also likely to cost the club. "The 42-year-old has three years remaining on the lucrative contract he was given by Everton at the end of his first season in charge in 2014," says <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/may/12/roberto-martinez-end-of-season-awards-everton" target="_blank">The Guardian</a>. "The manager is believed to earn at least £3m a year and the club's hierarchy faces a substantial severance payment for the remainder of Martinez's contract and those of his backroom staff."</p>
<p>The Toffees got to the semi-finals of both cups this season, but came unstuck after losing in the FA Cup. Martinez's relationship with fans and players has collapsed, says Elliott Bretland of <a href="http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3586553/Everton-boss-Roberto-Martinez-brink-tactics-results-recruitment-Sportsmail-gives-verdict-Spaniard-passed-failed-Goodison.html%20%20%20" target="_blank">Mail Online</a>. "Conceding ten goals in their last three away matches, Everton have allowed 121 shots on goal in their last five games," he notes.</p>
<p>Martinez's tactical acumen has also been questioned, with Everton dropping 48 points from winning positions during his reign. This season, "the side have lacked any penetration, idly passed the ball around defence and looked devoid of ideas when they do labour forward... and it was clear the 42-year-old lacked a Plan B", says Bretland.</p>
<p>Frank de Boer has emerged as the early favourite to succeed Martinez, reports The Telegraph. He resigned as coach of Ajax on Wednesday after his agent made it clear he would be interested in the Everton job.</p>
<p>Odds on the former Dutch international taking over are just 2-5 on.</p>
<p>Other names in the frame include Stoke boss Mark Hughes, outgoing Manchester City boss Manuel Pellegrini and former manager David Moyes, who was at Goodison Park for ten years before he moved to Manchester United.</p>
<p>An announcement is not expected before the weekend, with David Unsworth in line to take charge for the Norwich game. </p>
          </div>
      </div><div class="field field-name-field-tags field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/tags/roberto-martinez">Roberto Martinez</a></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><a href="/premier-league">Premier League</a></div>      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/frank-de-boer">Frank de Boer</a></div>    </div></div></description>

  <item>
    <title>Has Google killed off payday loans?</title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/72554/has-google-killed-off-payday-loans</link>
    <description><div class="primary-image">
      <div id="file-94805" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg file-default">
  
  
  <div class="content">    <img src="http://cdn2.theweek.co.uk/sites/theweek/files/styles/article_main_image/public/2016/05/160512-google.jpg?itok=sfDY_672" alt="google" title="google" /><div class="field field-name-field-file-credits field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Credits&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Leon Neal/Getty Images</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-alt-text field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Alt Text&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">google</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>  </div>
<p class="short-teaser">
Internet giant bans high-interest short-term lenders from touting their wares online</p>
<span class="field field-name-field-article-type field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">
      <span class="field-item even"><a href="/one-minute-read">One-Minute Read</a></span>
  </span><div class="field field-name-field-published-date field-type-datetime field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Thursday, May 12, 2016 - 3:19pm</span></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-related-articles field-type-node-reference field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">See related&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">
<div class="node node-article node-promoted even node-inline-teaser">

          <h5><span><a href="/business/55929/payday-lenders-are-wrong-target-poverty-villain">Payday lenders are the wrong target: poverty is the villain</a></span></h5>
      
  
  <div class="content">

    
    
      </div>

  
</div>
</div>      <div class="field-item odd">
<div class="node node-article node-promoted odd node-inline-teaser">

          <h5><span><a href="/business/61288/new-fca-cap-could-wipe-out-payday-lenders-within-a-year">New FCA cap could &#039;wipe out  payday lenders within a year&#039;</a></span></h5>
      
  
  <div class="content">

    
    
      </div>

  
</div>
</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-body">
            <div class="field-item even">
        <p> Google may have killed off a payday loan sector that is already reeling from years of regulatory clampdowns.</p>
<div class="field field-name-field-related-articles field-type-node-reference field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">See related&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/business/55929/payday-lenders-are-wrong-target-poverty-villain">Payday lenders are the wrong target: poverty is the villain</a></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><a href="/business/61288/new-fca-cap-could-wipe-out-payday-lenders-within-a-year">New FCA cap could &#039;wipe out  payday lenders within a year&#039;</a></div>    </div></div><p>In a blog posted yesterday, <a href="http://googlepublicpolicy.blogspot.co.uk/2016/05/an-update-to-our-adwords-policy-on.html" target="_blank">David Graff</a>, the director of global product policy, announced the internet giant will ban adverts featuring high-interest short-term lenders from July.</p>
<p>The move was in response to research that showed "these loans can result in unaffordable payment and high default rates" for consumers, he added.</p>
<p>The ban applies to ads for "loans where repayment is due within 60 days of the date of issue". In the US, it will also cover any other product with an annual interest rate in excess of 36 per cent. Payday lenders will not be censored from general search results, however.</p>
<p>Google's ban potentially represents an existential crisis for the lenders. The <a href="http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/958196dc-178a-11e6-9d98-00386a18e39d.html#axzz488w9oNGh" target="_blank">Financial Times</a> notes the search engine accounts for fully one-third of the $159bn (£109bn) of online advertising spend around the world each year.</p>
<p>"Many payday lenders rely on internet searches to generate customers," says the <a href="http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-36272031" target="_blank">BBC</a>. "It is possible Google's move could have more impact on curbing the industry than government regulation."</p>
<p>That is not to say clampdowns of recent years have been ineffective. After the latest overhaul of <a href="http://www.theweek.co.uk/business/61288/new-fca-cap-could-wipe-out-payday-lenders-within-a-year" target="_self">lending rules in the UK last year</a>, which capped the daily interest rate at 0.8 per cent and total costs at 100 per cent of the amount borrowed, the number of loans issued <a href="http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/b59f8638-0009-11e6-ac98-3c15a1aa2e62.html#axzz488w9oNGh" target="_blank">fell by more than two-thirds</a>. It is thought the sector, which once boasted 400 participants, will be reduced to a handful of lenders.</p>
<p>Market leader Wonga has already been forced to switch its focus to longer-term loans repayable over three months - and penalties for past practice <a href="http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-36201486" target="_blank">doubled its losses last year</a>. The second largest lender in the market, Dollar Financial, which owns the Money Shop among other brands, was <a href="http://www.theweek.co.uk/66276/payday-lender-dollar-financial-ordered-to-hand-back-154m%20%20%20" target="_self">fined £15m in October</a>.</p>
<p>Lenders' lobby groups were highly critical of Google's move.  </p>
<p>"It's disappointing that a site created to help give users full access to information is making arbitrary choices on the advertisements users are allowed to see from legal businesses," said Lisa McGreevy, president of the Online Lenders Association. </p>
          </div>
      </div><div class="field field-name-field-category-secondary field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/uk-business">UK business</a></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-tags field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/tags/payday-loans">payday loans</a></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><a href="/google">Google</a></div>    </div></div></description>

  <item>
    <title>New era beckons for Spurs as Pochettino extends contract</title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/mauricio-pochettino/72552/new-era-beckons-for-spurs-as-pochettino-extends-contract</link>
    <description><div class="primary-image">
      <div id="file-94800" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg file-default">
  
  
  <div class="content">    <img src="http://cdn2.theweek.co.uk/sites/theweek/files/styles/article_main_image/public/2016/05/160512-pochettino.jpg?itok=ewt17bxU" alt="Mauricio Pochettino" title="Mauricio Pochettino" /><div class="field field-name-field-file-description field-type-text-long field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Description&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> Tottenham manager Mauricio Pochettino, seen here applauding fans, has just signed a deal that will run until 2021 </p>
</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-credits field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Credits&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Michael Regan/Getty Images</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-alt-text field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Alt Text&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Mauricio Pochettino</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>  </div>
<p class="short-teaser">
Manager commits to Tottenham until 2021 and says he &#039;could not be happier&#039; as the club prepare to finish above Arsenal</p>
<span class="field field-name-field-article-type field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">
      <span class="field-item even"><a href="/one-minute-read">One-Minute Read</a></span>
  </span><div class="field field-name-field-published-date field-type-datetime field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Thursday, May 12, 2016 - 2:55pm</span></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-related-articles field-type-node-reference field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">See related&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">
<div class="node node-article node-promoted even node-inline-teaser">

          <h5><span><a href="/premier-league/68997/mauricio-pochettino-is-spurs-boss-the-man-for-chelsea-or-man-utd">Mauricio Pochettino: is Spurs boss the man for Chelsea or Man Utd?</a></span></h5>
      
  
  <div class="content">

    
    
      </div>

  
</div>
</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-body">
            <div class="field-item even">
        <p> Tottenham Hotspur may have missed out on the Premier League title, but they have been given a huge fillip ahead of the final game of the season with the news m<span>anager Mauricio Pochettino has signed a new contract that will keep him at White Hart Lane until 2021.</span></p>
<p><span>Assistant head coach Jesus Perez, first-team coach Miguel D'Agostino and goalkeeping coach Toni Jimenez have also extended their contracts.</span></p>
<div class="field field-name-field-related-articles field-type-node-reference field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">See related&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/business/55929/payday-lenders-are-wrong-target-poverty-villain">Payday lenders are the wrong target: poverty is the villain</a></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><a href="/business/61288/new-fca-cap-could-wipe-out-payday-lenders-within-a-year">New FCA cap could &#039;wipe out  payday lenders within a year&#039;</a></div>    </div></div><p>Pochettino's deal was signed two weeks after he revealed a verbal agreement had been reached, an announcement that failed to end speculation that other clubs were after his services, in particular Manchester United.</p>
<p>Saying he could "not be happier", he said: "It was an easy decision for my coaching staff and I because we can feel the appreciation of everyone here – there is no better place to be right now."</p>
<p>Now "he and Spurs can look ahead to the summer", says the <a href="http://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/mauricio-pochettino-signs-new-tottenham-contact-25m-deal-keeps-him-at-spurs-until-2021-a3246221.html" target="_blank">Evening Standard</a>. "The retention of Pochettino will be a relief to Tottenham supporters, who have watched their team record their highest finish in the Premier League era this season."</p>
<p>They are also on course to finish above Arsenal for the first time in a generation.</p>
<p>"Pochettino has created a fast and powerful side with a backbone of young English players such as striker Harry Kane, defender Eric Dier and midfielder Dele Alli, who have all received their first international caps during the Argentine's tenure," notes the <a href="http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36275890" target="_blank">BBC</a>.</p>
<p>But it is not just on the pitch that Pochettino has impressed, says <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/may/12/mauricio-pochettino-signs-new-deal-future-tottenham-2021" target="_blank">The Guardian</a>. "It ought not to go unnoticed – and it has not at boardroom level – that Pochettino is £6.3m in credit on permanent fees spent across his four transfer windows at the club. Tottenham must finance their new £400m stadium, into which they intend to move in 2018-19, and so Pochettino's ability to succeed without heavy backing on the market is invaluable."</p>
<p>The paper adds that with Pochettino secure, a host of key players are set to commit their futures to the club as it hopes to enter a new era. </p>
          </div>
      </div><div class="field field-name-field-tags field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/spurs">Spurs</a></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><a href="/tags/white-hart-lane">White Hart Lane</a></div>    </div></div></description>

  </item>
  <item>
    <title>Google Cardboard: £15 VR headset arrives in UK</title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/72551/google-cardboard-15-vr-headset-arrives-in-uk</link>
    <description><div class="primary-image">
      <div id="file-94799" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg file-default">
  
  
  <div class="content">    <img src="http://cdn2.theweek.co.uk/sites/theweek/files/styles/article_main_image/public/2016/05/160512-google-cardboard.jpg?itok=tfV5nSXV" alt="Google cardboard" title="Google cardboard" /><div class="field field-name-field-file-credits field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Credits&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Thomas Samson/AFP/Getty Images</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-alt-text field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Alt Text&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Google cardboard</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>  </div>
<p class="short-teaser">
Flat-pack gadget offers a virtual-reality experience at a no-frills price</p>
<span class="field field-name-field-article-type field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">
      <span class="field-item even"><a href="/one-minute-read">One-Minute Read</a></span>
  </span><div class="field field-name-field-published-date field-type-datetime field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Thursday, May 12, 2016 - 2:35pm</span></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-body">
            <div class="field-item even">
        <p> Google Cardboard, the internet giant's virtual reality headset, is finally available to buy in the UK – priced at £15.               </p>
<p>It's taken two years for the gadget to arrive, says <a href="http://www.wired.co.uk/news/archive/2016-05/11/google-cardboard-vr-headset-uk-launch" target="_blank">Wired</a>. Google started selling the headsets in the US in 2014 and has shipped more than five million to date. It's on sale at the <a href="https://store.google.com/product/google_cardboard?utm_source=gp_cardboard&amp;utm_medium=social&amp;utm_campaign=cardboard_launch_5/10/16&amp;utm_content=acc" target="_blank">Google Store</a> and dispatches in a couple of days.</p>
<p>The idea behind the device is simple – it's "a no-frills enclosure that transforms a phone into a basic VR headset". But for a cardboard box with two lenses inside, there's a surprising amount that can be done with it.</p>
<p>Google has focussed on producing more content for the platform and there are now thousands of virtual reality games, apps and videos available. It's still a "stuttery experience", <a href="http://www.theverge.com/2015/5/28/8675177/google-cardboard-hands-on-io-2015" target="_blank">The Verge</a> says, but it's definitely something that can be used to "mess around in virtual reality".</p>
<p>Cardboard uses your smartphone as a screen and supports Android and iOS devices.</p>
<p>Rumours suggest Google could be working on a new VR headset with a 2016 launch in mind. It could be a much sturdier device, made from plastic and with built-in sensors and better lenses, and come at a higher price point. It would go up against the Samsung Gear and likely offer a similar experience but with more compatible devices.</p>
<p>For now, the flat-pack Cardboard remains the company's sole venture into virtual reality. It's even possible to make one at home yourself – Google has posted a list of instructions and the materials you'll need online.  </p>
          </div>
      </div><div class="field field-name-field-tags field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">

  <item>
    <title>Hyperloop One hits 0-116mph in one second</title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/72548/hyperloop-one-hits-0-116mph-in-one-second</link>
    <description><div class="primary-image">
      <div id="file-94795" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg file-default">
  
  
  <div class="content">    <img src="http://cdn2.theweek.co.uk/sites/theweek/files/styles/article_main_image/public/2016/05/160512-hyperloop.jpg?itok=LUAtQoRo" alt="hyperloop" title="hyperloop" /><div class="field field-name-field-file-credits field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Credits&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">David Becker/Getty Images</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-alt-text field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Alt Text&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">hyperloop</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>  </div>
<p class="short-teaser">
Elon Musk&#039;s dream comes a step closer to reality, with hopes for supersonic trains running in 2021</p>
<span class="field field-name-field-article-type field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">
      <span class="field-item even"><a href="/one-minute-read">One-Minute Read</a></span>
  </span><div class="field field-name-field-published-date field-type-datetime field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Thursday, May 12, 2016 - 2:17pm</span></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-body">
            <div class="field-item even">
        <p> The first public demonstration of a hyperloop train, the proposed supersonic transport system, has taken place in the Nevada desert, taking its "first tentative step towards reality", says <a href="//www.theguardian.com/technology/2016/may/11/hyperloop-supersonic-train-test-propulsion-system" target="_blank">The Guardian</a>.<br />
<div id="file-94794" class="file file-video file-video-youtube file-content-original">
<div class="content">
<div class="media-youtube-video media-image media-youtube-1">
<iframe class="media-youtube-player" width="640" height="390" title="Hyperloop One First Public Test" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/vZZksTnGs5M?wmode=opaque" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen>Video of Hyperloop One First Public Test</iframe></div>
</div>
</div>
<p> </p>
<p>Hyperloop One, one of the two main companies battling to make the technology a reality, accelerated a sled to 116mph in just 1.1 seconds.</p>
<p>It is hoped these early tests will bloom into the full scale adoption of trains that can carry passengers and cargo at the speed of sound, an idea first pitched by tech billionaire Elon Musk in 2013.</p>
<p>According to the <a href="http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-36273151" target="_blank">BBC</a>, Hyperloop One's executives hope it could form mass transit systems in only five years, with ambitions of travelling from Los Angeles to San Francisco in 30 minutes by 2021.</p>
<p>"It's real. It's happening now," said chief executive Rob Lloyd.</p>
<p>Compared to this early demonstration, eventual hyperloop trains will run in sealed, low pressure tubes for minimal air resistance. Yesterday's test was of the electromagnetic drive component – the propulsion system that could eventually propel capsules at speeds of around 760mph.</p>
<p>Hyperloop One is looking to build a more complete system for extensive tests by the end of the year, says <a href="http://www.forbes.com/sites/aarontilley/2016/05/11/the-first-public-hyperloop-test-dazzling-and-done-in-two-seconds/#4fe4c20e538a" target="_blank">Forbes</a>. Huge steel tubes for the future track are already on site, with the hope of sending the sled around at speeds of 400mph.</p>
<p>Hyperloop executives say that riding in the system will be "like an elevator", <a href="http://www.gizmag.com/hyperloop-one-dmonstration/43283/" target="_blank">GizMag</a> reports executives as saying, with a brief acceleration of under 2.5g followed by a ride without turbulence or the sensation of sharp turns, on a capsule with no windows. </p>
          </div>
      </div><div class="field field-name-field-tags field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">

  <item>
    <title>Can Rafa Benitez save Newcastle United from 'toxic' owners? </title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/newcastle-united/72547/can-rafa-benitez-save-newcastle-united-from-toxic-owners</link>
    <description><div class="primary-image">
      <div id="file-94792" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg file-default">
  
  
  <div class="content">    <img src="http://cdn1.theweek.co.uk/sites/theweek/files/styles/article_main_image/public/2016/05/160512-benitez.jpg?itok=RzNsFy4d" alt="Rafa Benitez" title="Rafa Benitez" /><div class="field field-name-field-file-credits field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Credits&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Glyn Kirk/AFP/Getty</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-alt-text field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Alt Text&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Rafa Benitez</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>  </div>
<p class="short-teaser">
St James&#039; Park needs to be &#039;fumigated&#039; after another relegation under Mike Ashley, say critics</p>
<span class="field field-name-field-article-type field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">
      <span class="field-item even"><a href="/reaction">Reaction</a></span>
  </span><div class="field field-name-field-published-date field-type-datetime field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Thursday, May 12, 2016 - 1:31pm</span></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-body">
            <div class="field-item even">
        <p> Newcastle United have been relegated to the Championship at the hands of bitter local rivals Sunderland, who sent the Magpies down with victory over Everton last night.</p>
<p>It is the second time the club have gone down since owner Mike Ashley took over at St James' Park in 2007, and the reaction of most observers has not been to twist the knife as much as to feed the club and the regime into a blender.</p>
<p>Current manager Rafa Benitez (pictured above), who arrived with ten games left in the season, was not given enough time to turn the club around and it remains to be seen whether he will stay next season despite his popularity with the fans, which is in stark contrast to the standing of Ashley.</p>
<p>The Sports Direct boss is a hate figure on Tyneside - and with good reason, it seems, as it is he and his acolytes who are responsible for the Magpies' sorry predicament in the eyes of most observers.</p>
<p>There can be no doubt Newcastle "have spent big and badly, entrusted inadequate people with too much power, played with fear and acted too late", says George Caulkin of <a href="http://www.thetimes.co.uk/edition/sport/shambolic-newcastle-have-become-a-shell-of-a-club-overseen-by-pygmies-c3lkr22qn" target="_blank">The Times</a>. "Newcastle have become a shell, overseen by pygmies.</p>
<p>"In a season when Leicester City have shown the value of sound recruitment, Newcastle wasted £80m," he continues. "An uneasy, flawed policy... has now blossomed into calamity.</p>
<p>"If Benitez stays - he has been swayed by the warmth of supporters - the bitterness of relegation would be tempered, but Newcastle needs fumigating."</p>
<p>Quite so, says Craig Hope in the <a href="http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3585614/Newcastle-s-relegation-came-sticking-Steve-McClaren-example-gross-negligence-toxic-ownership.html" target="_blank">Daily Mail</a>, who lays the blame at the door of Ashley and the two men he appointed to run the club, chief executive Lee Charnley and scout Graham Carr.</p>
<p>"Newcastle United deserve relegation," Hope rages. "They deserve to go down for appointing a failed Championship manager last summer and then allowing him to remain in post for 28 games.</p>
<p>"They deserve to go down for treating supporters with utter contempt for the best part of nine years under Mike Ashley's toxic ownership.</p>
<p>"And Ashley deserves the financial loss - £200m is the latest estimate - for blindly trusting Charnley and chief scout Graham Carr to run the club in the first place."</p>
<p>The pair helped assemble the most expensive side to ever be relegated from the Premier League. "If anyone wants an example of hubris, they need look no further than the St James' Park boardroom," says Louise Taylor of <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2016/may/12/newcastle-relegation-championship-mike-ashley-board-rafael-benitez%20%20%20" target="_blank">The Guardian</a>.</p>
<p>Newcastle are in a mess of their own creation, but their cloud could have a silver lining.  "What matters now is somehow persuading Benitez to stay before allowing him to implement far-reaching reform. The alternative is too agonising to contemplate," says Taylor.</p>
<p>The coach is already a fan favourite and could become their saviour: "Behind a warm, genial exterior the 56-year-old is a consummate political operator in whom the Sports Direct owner may have met his match." </p>
          </div>
      </div><div class="field field-name-field-tags field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/premier-league">Premier League</a></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><a href="/tags/rafa-benitez">Rafa Benitez</a></div>      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/tags/mike-ashley">Mike Ashley</a></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><a href="/tags/championship">Championship</a></div>    </div></div></description>

  <item>
    <title>What is the New IRA and how dangerous is it?</title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/72541/what-is-the-new-ira-and-how-dangerous-is-it</link>
    <description><div class="primary-image">
      <div id="file-94787" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg file-default">
  
  
  <div class="content">    <img src="http://cdn1.theweek.co.uk/sites/theweek/files/styles/article_main_image/public/2016/05/160512-ira.jpg?itok=UmqMz0L4" alt="Northern Ireland IRA police" title="Northern Ireland IRA police" /><div class="field field-name-field-file-credits field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Credits&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Jeff J Mitchell/Getty Images</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-alt-text field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Alt Text&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Northern Ireland IRA police</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>  </div>
<p class="short-teaser">
Theresa May warns of &#039;strong possibility&#039; of terrorist attack from dissident republicans</p>
<span class="field field-name-field-article-type field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">
      <span class="field-item even"><a href="/in-depth">In Depth</a></span>
  </span><div class="field field-name-field-published-date field-type-datetime field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Thursday, May 12, 2016 - 12:32pm</span></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-body">
            <div class="field-item even">
        <p> Britain has raised the threat of a terror attack by Irish republican dissidents from "moderate" to "substantial" more than 15 years after the last bombing on the British mainland.</p>
<p>It is a move that will evoke memories of the IRA bombings that wreaked havoc in the 1970s, 80s and 90s and cost the lives of more than 1,800 people.</p>
<p>"A century after the Easter Rising – almost to the day - the spectre of Northern Ireland terrorism on the Britain mainland has returned," says <a href="http://www.itv.com/news/2016-05-11/the-spectre-of-northern-ireland-terrorism-has-returned/" target="_blank">ITV News</a>.</p>
<p>Home Secretary Theresa May said the decision means a terrorist attack is a "strong possibility" and reflects the continuing threat from dissident republican activity.</p>
<p>She concluded that while the vast majority of people in both Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland desired peace, it was "sensible" that the public and authorities in Britain "remain vigilant".</p>
<p>Republican militants have been increasing their attacks in Northern Ireland while also becoming more "ambitious", says the <a href="http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/05/11/attack-on-mainland-from-irish-republicans-strong-possibility-as/" target="_blank">Daily Telegraph</a>.</p>
<p>It is understood that, for every dissident attack in Northern Ireland, "the security service foils three to four", the paper says, and the fresh assessment of the threat "is a result of concerns about the increasing capabilities of these groups and their growing desire to attack the mainland".</p>
<p>Though no terror organisation was specifically named in the announcement, it is understood to reflect fears about the group widely referred to as the New IRA, says the <a href="http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-northern-ireland-36269175" target="_blank">BBC</a>.</p>
<h5>Who is the New IRA?</h5>
<p>It includes a range of different groups, including the Real IRA and the Republican Action against Drugs (RAAD), which came together under the banner of the New IRA in 2012. At the time, it put out a statement to say there was a "necessity of armed struggle in pursuit of Irish freedom" and vowed to step up attacks against British targets.</p>
<p>In a statement to mark the 100th anniversary of the 1916 Easter Rising in Dublin, the group said it was "ready and determined to take the war to the age old enemy of our nation".</p>
<p>The <a href="http://www.irishtimes.com/news/ireland/irish-news/new-ira-the-deadliest-of-the-dissident-republican-groupings-1.2563243" target="_blank">Irish Times</a> describes the New IRA as the largest and "deadliest" of the republican groupings.</p>
<p>Its member were blamed for the shooting of a man in Londonderry in April that bore the hallmarks of a paramilitary style attack, as well as the murder of prison officer David Black in 2012.</p>
<p>The group also claimed responsibility for the killing of Belfast prison officer Adrian Ismay in March, who died after a booby-trap device exploded under his van.</p>
<p>Senior security officers say the New IRA has increased its capacity to wage violence by obtaining semtex, which was believed to have been involved in Ismay's killing, <a href="http://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2016/may/11/republican-dissident-terror-threat-level-raised-in-britain" target="_blank">The Guardian</a> reports.</p>
<p>Nevertheless, <a href="http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-36267052" target="_blank">BBC</a> security correspondent Frank Gardner said that, while there was now a "real fear" in the security services that deadly tactics of the past would be used again, the "far bigger" threat to Great Britain came from Islamic State and its supporters. </p>
          </div>
      </div><div class="field field-name-field-tags field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/tags/ira">IRA</a></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><a href="/tags/northern-ireland">Northern Ireland</a></div>      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/tags/terrorism">Terrorism</a></div>    </div></div></description>

  <item>
    <title>Suliman Gani: Cameron apologises for Islamic State claim</title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/72538/suliman-gani-cameron-apologises-for-islamic-state-claim</link>
    <description><div class="primary-image">
      <div id="file-77610" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg file-default">
  
  
  <div class="content">    <img src="http://cdn2.theweek.co.uk/sites/theweek/files/styles/article_main_image/public/6/10/david_cameron_1_0.jpg?itok=aF9ZQg52" alt="David Cameron" title="David Cameron" /><div class="field field-name-field-file-credits field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Credits&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Carl Court</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-alt-text field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Alt Text&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">David Cameron</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>  </div>
<p class="short-teaser">
Former imam said to be taking legal action after being wrongly linked to terror group </p>
<span class="field field-name-field-article-type field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">
      <span class="field-item even"><a href="/one-minute-read">One-Minute Read</a></span>
  </span><div class="field field-name-field-published-date field-type-datetime field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Thursday, May 12, 2016 - 11:58am</span></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-body">
            <div class="field-item even">
        <p> David Cameron has apologised to former imam Suliman Gani for suggesting he supported Islamic State during a Commons debate in the run-up to the London mayoral election.</p>
<p>Speaking during Prime Minister's Questions, Cameron told MPs that Labour's Sadiq Khan had shared platforms with "extremists", naming Gani specifically.</p>
<p>"This man supports IS," he added.</p>
<p>But last night, Downing Street clarified that the Prime Minister was referring to reports that Gani supported "an Islamic state", rather than the terror group known as Islamic State.</p>
<p>"In reference to the Prime Minister's comments on Suliman Gani, the Prime Minister was referring to reports that he supports an Islamic state. The Prime Minister is clear this does not mean Mr Gani supports the organisation Daesh [IS] and he apologises to him for any misunderstanding," said a spokesman for No 10.</p>
<p>Gani, a former imam at the Tooting Islamic Centre, is said to be threatening legal action against Defence Secretary Michael Fallon, who repeated the accusation during a Radio 4 interview. The Prime Minister is protected by parliamentary privilege as he made his comments in the Commons.</p>
<p>A spokesman for Fallon said: "Michael made clear he was quoting a claim by Andrew Neil on a BBC mayoral debate programme. He was unaware of the clarification and apology that the BBC had issued on Neil's claim.</p>
<p>"Had he been aware, he would not of course have quoted him and as soon as he became aware he put the record straight. He naturally apologises for this inadvertent error."</p>
<p>Lawyers acting for Gani told <a href="http://www.lbc.co.uk/ex-imam-begins-legal-action-against-defence-secretary-130303" target="_blank">LBC</a> that he has faced attacks in his local community and that he fears for the safety of his family and children.</p>
<p>Gani also told the station: "It is really stressful, my family are upset. I am utterly shocked that someone of such a high-ranking position, the defence secretary, can make such a preposterous statement." </p>
          </div>
      </div><div class="field field-name-field-category-secondary field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/people">People</a></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-tags field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/david-cameron">David Cameron</a></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><a href="/islamic-state">Islamic State</a></div>      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/tags/michael-fallon">Michael Fallon</a></div>    </div></div></description>

  <item>
    <title>Sunderland escape relegation as Sam Allardyce strikes again</title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/premier-league/72537/sunderland-escape-relegation-as-sam-allardyce-strikes-again</link>
    <description><div class="primary-image">
      <div id="file-94784" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg file-default">
  
  
  <div class="content">    <img src="http://cdn1.theweek.co.uk/sites/theweek/files/styles/article_main_image/public/2016/05/160512-allardyce.jpg?itok=v4jBAM2T" alt="Sam Allardyce" title="Sam Allardyce" /><div class="field field-name-field-file-description field-type-text-long field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Description&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> Manager Sam Allardyce celebrates after keeping Sunderland in the Premier League </p>
</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-credits field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Credits&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Ian MacNicol/Getty Images</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-alt-text field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Alt Text&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Sam Allardyce</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>  </div>
<p class="short-teaser">
Future looks bright for the Black Cats – and it&#039;s all down to their manager </p>
<span class="field field-name-field-article-type field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">
      <span class="field-item even"><a href="/reaction">Reaction</a></span>
  </span><div class="field field-name-field-published-date field-type-datetime field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Thursday, May 12, 2016 - 11:18am</span></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-body">
            <div class="field-item even">
        <p> Sunderland brought the curtain down on this year's relegation scrap in emphatic fashion, beating Everton 3-0 at the Stadium of Light to secure another season of top flight football and condemn Norwich and Newcastle to the drop.</p>
<p>The Black Cats may have saved themselves, but they are running out of lives. This was the fourth year in a row they have dodged the drop at the business end of the season - although few supporters were concerned with that statistic as they revelled in their survival and the fate of their local rivals at St James' Park.</p>
<p>Key to Sunderland's success has been the impact of manager Sam Allardyce, who took over from Dick Advocaat in October, when the team were second bottom of the table and winless.</p>
<p>The achievement is "particularly sweet" for Big Sam, says George Caulkin of <a href="http://www.thetimes.co.uk/edition/sport/sunderland-relegate-rivals-with-victory-2fbtmhz2p" target="_blank">The Times</a>, as he was fired by Newcastle in 2008, after just 24 games in charge. He has also been involved with a feud with Magpies manager Rafa Benitez dating back to their time at Bolton and Liverpool.</p>
<p>Sunderland hired Allardyce because he has never been relegated from the Premier League - a record that remains intact after a difficult season.</p>
<p>"As well as refreshing an impoverished first-team squad in January and overseeing an improvement in results — Sunderland have lost only four league games in 2016 — he has dealt with the impact of Adam Johnson's dismissal and imprisonment for child-sex offences," says Caulkin,</p>
<p>Allardyce is not a "fashionable" manager, says Martin Samuel of the <a href="http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3585396/Sunderland-3-0-Everton-Sam-Allardyce-s-secure-safety-send-Norwich-Newcastle-Championship.html" target="_blank">Daily Mail</a>, but he has won over the Sunderland support.</p>
<p>"There will always be a number of clubs that need simple security and that is what he offers," he says. "He is much more than a Red Adair rescue act, though, and the way he has turned this diseased club around, under pressure, and with only one flaky January transfer window to make improvements cannot be underestimated."</p>
<p>The contrast with Newcastle could not be greater, adds Samuel. While the Magpies scrambled to stay up and failed, Sunderland gave Allardyce enough time to turn things round. Survival was down to "four months of consistently impressive performances, chock full of character, determination and a fair bit of quality too", says Chris Young of the <a href="http://www.sunderlandecho.com/sport/football/sunderland-afc/chris-young-now-sunderland-must-look-upwards-after-another-act-of-escapology-1-7906619" target="_blank">Sunderland Echo</a>.</p>
<p>"Crucially, the strength of the spirit in the Sunderland dressing room has been evident for months," he adds. Allardyce "deserves enormous credit for what he has achieved, when on several occasions, all seemed lost".</p>
<p>Young notes that victory over Everton means the team now average a point a game for the first time this season. "What a time to do it."</p>
<p>What's more, he adds, a good summer in the transfer market and Sunderland will have the foundations of a successful side. </p>
          </div>
      </div><div class="field field-name-field-tags field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">
