  <item>
    <title>One in four pregnancies ends in abortion, say new global estimates</title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/72536/one-in-four-pregnancies-ends-in-abortion-say-new-global-estimates</link>
    <description><div class="primary-image">
      <div id="file-76446" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg file-default">
  
  
  <div class="content">    <img src="http://cdn2.theweek.co.uk/sites/theweek/files/styles/article_main_image/public/4/46/140630-morning-after_0.jpg?itok=rXChVAiV" alt="The morning-after pill" title="The morning-after pill" /><div class="field field-name-field-file-credits field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Credits&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Jasper Juinen/Getty Images</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-alt-text field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Alt Text&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">The morning-after pill</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>  </div>
<p class="short-teaser">
WHO report suggests a &#039;stark and troubling divide&#039; in termination rates around the world</p>
<span class="field field-name-field-article-type field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">
      <span class="field-item even"><a href="/one-minute-read">One-Minute Read</a></span>
  </span><div class="field field-name-field-published-date field-type-datetime field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Thursday, May 12, 2016 - 11:07am</span></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-body">
            <div class="field-item even">
        <p> One in four pregnancies ends in abortion, according to global estimates from the World Health Organisation (WHO).</p>
<p>The study, published in <a href="http://www.thelancet.com/journals/lancet/article/PII[thelancet.com]S0140-6736(16)30380-4/abstract" target="_blank">The Lancet</a>, shows the annual number of abortions worldwide increased from 50 million a year between 1990-1994 to 56 million a year between 2010-2014.</p>
<p>But there is a "stark and troubling divide between what's happening in wealthier, developed countries versus their poorer and less developed counterparts", says the <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/to-your-health/wp/2016/05/11/abortion-falls-to-all-time-low-in-developed-countries-but-remains-virtually-unchanged-in-developing-countries/" target="_blank">Washington Post</a>.</p>
<p>The researchers found that between 1990 and 2014, the developed world's annual abortion rate per 1,000 women dropped from 46 to 27, mainly, they say, as a result of the rate in Eastern Europe more than halving as modern contraceptive methods became more widely available.</p>
<p>However, the rate remained relatively unchanged in the developing world, dropping slightly from 39 to 37.</p>
<p>"We think this is because the desire for small families and precisely timed births has outpaced the uptake of contraceptive use," said Gilda Sedgh, a principal research scientist with the Guttmacher Institute, which co-funded the study.</p>
<p>The report also found that rates of abortion were constant across all countries, regardless of the legal issues. In Latin America, where abortion is heavily restricted, one in three pregnancies ends in termination – higher than any other region in the world.</p>
<p>These findings suggest that "restrictive abortion laws do not limit the number of abortions", say the researchers.</p>
<p>"The high rates of abortion seen in our study provide further evidence of the need to improve and expand access to effective contraceptive services," said Dr Bela Ganatra of the WHO.</p>
<p>"Investing in modern contraceptive methods would be far less costly to women and to society than having unwanted pregnancies and unsafe abortions," she added.</p>
<p>But the study implies the solution is "not as simple as improving access to contraceptives", reports the <a href="http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-36266873" target="_blank">BBC</a>.</p>
<p>Many women said they had chosen not to use contraceptives because they were worried about side effects, felt stigmatised or thought there was a low risk they would become pregnant, adds the broadcaster. </p>
          </div>
      </div><div class="field field-name-field-tags field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/abortion">Abortion</a></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><a href="/tags/who-0">WHO</a></div>      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/latin-america">Latin America</a></div>    </div></div></description>

  <item>
    <title>Cameron clamps down on offshore-owners of UK property</title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/72534/cameron-clamps-down-on-offshore-owners-of-uk-property</link>
    <description><div class="primary-image">
      <div id="file-85078" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg file-default">
  
  
  <div class="content">    <img src="http://cdn2.theweek.co.uk/sites/theweek/files/styles/article_main_image/public/2015/10/151006-cameron.jpg?itok=Mw3H-d5O" alt="David Cameron" title="David Cameron" /><div class="field field-name-field-file-credits field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Credits&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Luke MacGregor/WPA Pool/Getty Images</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-alt-text field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Alt Text&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">David Cameron</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>  </div>
<p class="short-teaser">
Mystery firms to be unmasked as Prime Minister reveals new measures to tackle financial corruption </p>
<span class="field field-name-field-article-type field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">
      <span class="field-item even"><a href="/one-minute-read">One-Minute Read</a></span>
  </span><div class="field field-name-field-published-date field-type-datetime field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Thursday, May 12, 2016 - 11:02am</span></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-related-articles field-type-node-reference field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">See related&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">
<div class="node node-article node-promoted odd node-inline-teaser">

          <h5><span><a href="/72530/anti-corruption-summit-who-is-going-and-whats-on-the-agenda">Anti-corruption summit: Who is going and what&#039;s on the agenda</a></span></h5>
      
  
  <div class="content">

    
    
      </div>

  
</div>
</div>      <div class="field-item odd">
<div class="node node-article node-promoted even node-inline-teaser">

          <h5><span><a href="/71544/tax-havens-have-no-economic-purpose-say-economists">Tax havens &#039;have no economic purpose&#039;, say economists</a></span></h5>
      
  
  <div class="content">

    
    
      </div>

  
</div>
</div>      <div class="field-item even">
<div class="node node-article node-promoted odd node-inline-teaser">

          <h5><span><a href="/71309/panama-papers-what-are-the-super-wealthy-accused-of-doing">Panama Papers: What are the super-wealthy accused of doing?</a></span></h5>
      
  
  <div class="content">

    
    
      </div>

  
</div>
</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-body">
            <div class="field-item even">
        <p> David Cameron has attempted to regain the initiative on tackling financial corruption by announcing a package of legislative reforms, including a clampdown on offshore companies which have bought as much as £150bn worth of UK property.</p>
<div class="field field-name-field-related-articles field-type-node-reference field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">See related&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/business/55929/payday-lenders-are-wrong-target-poverty-villain">Payday lenders are the wrong target: poverty is the villain</a></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><a href="/business/61288/new-fca-cap-could-wipe-out-payday-lenders-within-a-year">New FCA cap could &#039;wipe out  payday lenders within a year&#039;</a></div>    </div></div><p>The Prime Minister announced the plans in an article for <a href="http://www.theguardian.com/politics/2016/may/11/david-cameron-corporate-money-laundering-offence-anti-corruption-summit" target="_blank">The Guardian</a> today, ahead of hosting an international anti-corruption summit which has taken on added significance since the huge Panama Papers data leak exposed the activities of the rich and powerful in tax havens.</p>
<p>Under the proposed new rules, any company wishing to buy a property in the UK will have to disclose their "true owners in a public register for the first time".</p>
<p>The <a href="http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-36272225" target="_blank">BBC</a> adds the demand will also apply to any company that is competing for government outsourcing contracts.</p>
<p>This could be a major development in the fight against financial crime. Last July, Donald Toon, the director of economic crime at the National Crime Agency, told the <a href="http://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2015/jul/25/london-housing-market-launder-offshore-tax-havens" target="_blank">Guardian</a> London had become the "money laundering capital of the world" because of the huge investment in property by opaque companies based in secretive tax havens.</p>
<p>Toon spoke out after data showed that a new tax on properties owned by companies had raised more than £140m in its first three months alone. The <a href="http://www.thesundaytimes.co.uk/sto/news/uk_news/Society/article1597201.ece" target="_blank">Sunday Times</a> reported last August that since 1999, almost 36,000 companies had bought 96,440 UK properties worth around £150bn, of which £112bn related to residential houses.</p>
<p>Criminals investing in UK property through an offshore company would have almost total secrecy and would be able, at a later date, to realise the value of their asset without any links to the original, illegal source of the funds.</p>
<p>Cameron's anti-corruption drive will also see a new criminal offence created that would punish executives for failing to "prevent fraud or money laundering inside their companies". This would be particularly aimed at the chiefs of global banking groups, which have been heavily fined for involvement in corruption in recent years but whose bosses have escaped almost entirely unscathed.</p>
<p>Elsewhere, a number of other countries, including France, Nigeria and the Netherlands, will join the UK in committing to set up public registers of beneficial ownership, with even some UK overseas territories agreeing to join 34 governments in "automatically and regularly" sharing registers of company ownership.</p>
<p>Critics will point out, however, that the British territories of the Cayman Islands and British Virgin Islands, which was the haven most exposed in the Panama Papers leak, have not signed up to any such initiative.</p>
<p>"Cameron has registered his displeasure with the [British Virgin Islands'] refusal to join the automatic exchange initiative by refusing to invite its officials to the summit," notes the Guardian. Some will argue that as prime minister, he can and should go much further to force the issue. </p>
          </div>
      </div><div class="field field-name-field-category-secondary field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/politics">Politics</a></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-tags field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/panama-papers-0">Panama Papers</a></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><a href="/tax">Tax</a></div>    </div></div></description>

  <item>
    <title>Islamic State launches alphabet app for children</title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/islamic-state/72533/islamic-state-launches-alphabet-app-for-children</link>
    <description><div class="primary-image">
      <div id="file-94783" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg file-default">
  
  
  <div class="content">    <img src="http://cdn1.theweek.co.uk/sites/theweek/files/styles/article_main_image/public/2016/05/150316-is-flag_0.jpg?itok=_YbNnKq-" alt="" />  </div>
</div>  </div>
<p class="short-teaser">
Huroof features educational games and songs &#039;littered with jihadist terminology&#039;</p>
<span class="field field-name-field-article-type field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">
      <span class="field-item even"><a href="/one-minute-read">One-Minute Read</a></span>
  </span><div class="field field-name-field-published-date field-type-datetime field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Thursday, May 12, 2016 - 9:50am</span></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-body">
            <div class="field-item even">
        <p> Islamic State has launched an app that helps children learn Arabic with the aid of guns, tanks and cannon.</p>
<p>Huroof - "letters", in Arabic - gives a step-by-step guide to the alphabet and offers games and Islamic songs "littered with jihadist terminology" to help users memorise words, reports Caleb Weiss at the <a href="http://www.longwarjournal.org/archives/2016/05/islamic-state-launches-mobile-app-for-children.php" target="_blank">Long War Journal</a>.</p>
<p>While clearly marketed towards children, the branding of stars, balloons and flowers masks military themes  and "tank", "gun", "cannon", "bullet" and "rocket" are among the vocabulary taught.</p>
<p>"The alphabet app is not the Islamic State's first mobile application. However, it is the first to be directed exclusively to children," says Weiss.</p>
<p>Other apps have been used as a means of distributing propaganda after the terror group encountered difficulties using mainstream internet services.</p>
<p>"The jihadist group has also produced several videos from many of its proclaimed provinces showing children being trained for jihad or being indoctrinated at Islamic State-ran schools. Other videos have shown children being involved in beheadings and executions of prisoners held by the Islamic State," says Weiss.</p>
<p>Encrypted messaging service Telegram, a favourite of the terror group, has said it is taking action to block IS users.</p>
<p>The news comes just days after the militants reportedly executed a seven-year-old boy by firing squad after he was heard swearing during a game of football with his friends.</p>
<p>According to the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights, IS killed at least 3,000 people, including women and children, in the 12 months after it declared a caliphate in June 2014.</p>
<p>Last month, the Taliban in Afghanistan launched an app called Alemarah in a bid to reach a wider digital audience with its propaganda videos. </p>
          </div>
      </div><div class="field field-name-field-tags field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/islamic-state">Islamic State</a></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><a href="/apps">apps</a></div>    </div></div></description>

  <item>
    <title>Power-drill corn 'scalps' woman with long hair</title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/72532/power-drill-corn-scalps-woman-with-long-hair</link>
    <description><div class="primary-image">
      <div id="file-94770" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg file-default">
  
  
  <div class="content">    <img src="http://cdn2.theweek.co.uk/sites/theweek/files/styles/article_main_image/public/2016/05/120516-wd-powerdrillcorn.jpg?itok=cGUxnaHN" alt="" />  </div>
</div>  </div>
<p class="short-teaser">
Chinese woman&#039;s attempt to copy YouTube stunt goes horribly wrong – and other tall tales</p>
<span class="field field-name-field-article-type field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">
      <span class="field-item even"><a href="/one-minute-read">One-Minute Read</a></span>
  </span><div class="field field-name-field-published-date field-type-datetime field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Thursday, May 12, 2016 - 9:45am</span></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-body">
            <div class="field-item even">
        <p> Our pick of the strange but true stories from around the world.</p>
<h5>Hair-raising meal</h5>
<p>A woman in China has been "scalped" while attempting to emulate YouTube performer Eater Yang's stunt of eating corn on the cob from a spinning power drill. The woman's hair became tangled in the drill, leaving her with a large bald spot on the top of her head. Claims that the footage was faked prompted her to release a number of other videos apparently showing her being treated by a doctor after the incident.</p>
<h5>Navy chopper's wee accident</h5>
<p>A Royal Navy helicopter has been caught on camera knocking over a row of portable toilets, sending plumes of toilet paper streaming into the sky. The low-flying chopper was moving a field gun when it got too close to the toilets and the downwash from its rotors spread the cabins – and their contents – over a wide area.<br />
<div id="file-94772" class="file file-video file-video-youtube file-content-original">
<div class="content">
<div class="media-youtube-video media-image media-youtube-13">
<iframe class="media-youtube-player" width="640" height="390" title="Merlin Helicopter downwash blows over portable toilets" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/XQcNwDuoxBk?wmode=opaque" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen>Video of Merlin Helicopter downwash blows over portable toilets</iframe></div>
</div>
</div>
<h5>Domino's store saves customer's life</h5>
<p>Workers at a Domino's Pizza shop have been credited with saving the life of a customer. When Kirk Alexander, who ordered food every day from the Oregon store, hadn't been in touch for 11 days, staff sent a driver around to his house to check up on him. However, the driver couldn't get an answer and so called the police, who broke into the house and found Alexander in "significant medical distress". He is now recovering in hospital.</p>
<p>  </p>
          </div>
      </div><div class="field field-name-field-category-secondary field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/world-news">World News</a></div>    </div></div></description>

 <dc:creator>Rebecca Gillie</dc:creator>

  </item>
  <item>
    <title>Agony aunt Sally Brampton dies after long battle with depression</title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/72531/agony-aunt-sally-brampton-dies-after-long-battle-with-depression</link>
    <description><div class="primary-image">
      <div id="file-94779" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg file-default">
  
  
  <div class="content">    <img src="http://cdn2.theweek.co.uk/sites/theweek/files/styles/article_main_image/public/2016/05/160512-brampton.jpg?itok=36ab1RhZ" alt="Sally Brampton" title="Sally Brampton" /><div class="field field-name-field-file-credits field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Credits&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Facebook</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-alt-text field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Alt Text&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Sally Brampton</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>  </div>
<p class="short-teaser">
Novelist&#039;s body was found washed up on a beach in Sussex by a member of the public</p>
<span class="field field-name-field-article-type field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">
      <span class="field-item even"><a href="/one-minute-read">One-Minute Read</a></span>
  </span><div class="field field-name-field-published-date field-type-datetime field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Thursday, May 12, 2016 - 9:28am</span></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-body">
            <div class="field-item even">
        <p> Novelist and agony aunt Sally Brampton, who wrote candidly about her clinical depression, has died at the age of 60.</p>
<p>Her body was reportedly spotted from a beach in Bexhill, Sussex, on Tuesday afternoon, and pulled ashore by a member of the public.</p>
<p>A spokeswoman for Sussex Police said: "An air ambulance landed on the beach, but sadly the woman was declared dead at the scene. There are not thought to be any suspicious circumstances."</p>
<p>Brampton had studied fashion at Central St Martin's in London. She started writing for Vogue after winning a talent contest in 1979 and later became fashion editor at The Observer before helping set up British Elle, where she was editor-in-chief for five years.</p>
<p>She worked as a columnist and agony aunt for several national publications, including The Sunday Times, Daily Mail and Psychologies magazine, and her books included a non-fiction memoir of depression, Shoot the Damn Dog.</p>
<p>In 2003, she wrote an article in the <a href="http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/health/3300771/I-told-myself-Get-over-yourself.-Stop-snivelling.-Stop-whining....html" target="_blank">Daily Telegraph</a> about trying to kill herself the previous year after being diagnosed with clinical depression.</p>
<p>"For me, depression was a place – is still a place with which I now have (mercifully brief) encounters," she wrote. "The landscape is cold and black and empty. It is more terrifying and more horrible than anywhere I have ever been, even in my nightmares.</p>
<p>"It is an abyss, a black hole, a place where nothing thrives, where sound is muffled so as to be unintelligible, where vision is dimmed until it is like seeing through clouded glass."<br />
<div id="file-94778" class="file file-video file-video-youtube file-content-original">
<div class="content">
<div class="media-youtube-video media-image media-youtube-1">
<iframe class="media-youtube-player" width="640" height="390" title="Sally Brampton on Depression" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/WvxEVHS22kc?wmode=opaque" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen>Video of Sally Brampton on Depression</iframe></div>
</div>
</div>
<p> </p>
<p>Fans paid tribute on Twitter to a "brave" woman who had helped them in times of need. "Her writing got me through such terribly dark times," wrote one, while others called her "a real inspiration".</p>
<p>Writer Tony Parsons said he was "choked" to hear she had died. "A great journalist, a lovely woman and as editor of Elle UK, she gave me work when I had none," he said.</p>
<p>Author Tammy Cohen said Brampton was a "brave journalist and human being", while Lorraine Candy, Elle's current editor-in-chief, said her team were mourning the loss of a "free-thinking, ground-breaking woman who will always be part of magazine history". </p>
          </div>
      </div><div class="field field-name-field-category-secondary field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">

  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/sally-brampton">Sally Brampton</a></div>    </div></div></description>

  <item>
    <title>Anti-corruption summit: Who is going and what's on the agenda</title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/72530/anti-corruption-summit-who-is-going-and-whats-on-the-agenda</link>
    <description><div class="primary-image">
      <div id="file-94777" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg file-default">
  
  
  <div class="content">    <img src="http://cdn1.theweek.co.uk/sites/theweek/files/styles/article_main_image/public/2016/05/160512-corruption.jpg?itok=UqltIcSd" alt="Anti-corruption summit" title="Anti-corruption summit" /><div class="field field-name-field-file-description field-type-text-long field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Description&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> Patricia Scotland, the secretary general of the Commonwealth, chats to Nigerian President Muhammadu Buhari ahead of the summit </p>
</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-credits field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Credits&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Leon Neal - WPA Pool/Getty Images</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-alt-text field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Alt Text&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Anti-corruption summit</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>  </div>
<p class="short-teaser">
Will David Cameron&#039;s conference be genuinely game-changing or a hypocrites&#039; ball?</p>
<span class="field field-name-field-article-type field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">
      <span class="field-item even"><a href="/in-depth">In Depth</a></span>
  </span><div class="field field-name-field-published-date field-type-datetime field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Thursday, May 12, 2016 - 9:24am</span></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-related-articles field-type-node-reference field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">See related&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">
<div class="node node-article node-promoted even node-inline-teaser">

          <h5><span><a href="/69039/pms-corruption-gaffe-which-countries-have-the-biggest-problem">PM&#039;s corruption gaffe: Which countries have the biggest problem?</a></span></h5>
      
  
  <div class="content">

    
    
      </div>

  
</div>
</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-body">
            <div class="field-item even">
        <p> David Cameron is hosting an international summit aiming to expose and tackle corruption around the world.</p>
<div class="field field-name-field-related-articles field-type-node-reference field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">See related&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/business/55929/payday-lenders-are-wrong-target-poverty-villain">Payday lenders are the wrong target: poverty is the villain</a></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><a href="/business/61288/new-fca-cap-could-wipe-out-payday-lenders-within-a-year">New FCA cap could &#039;wipe out  payday lenders within a year&#039;</a></div>    </div></div><p>It has the potential to be "genuinely game-changing", says Dr Dan Hough, the director of the Sussex Centre for the Study of Corruption. "But, as with all these things, the devil will be in the detail," he writes in the <a href="http://www.newstatesman.com/politics/staggers/2016/05/david-cameron-has-grand-anti-corruption-aims-can-he-do-justice-rhetoric" target="_blank">New Statesman</a>.</p>
<p>Others warn today's event could be overshadowed by the PM's <a href="/69039/pms-corruption-gaffe-which-countries-have-the-biggest-problem" target="_self">diplomatic gaffe</a> on Tuesday, when he said that some "fantastically corrupt" countries – namechecking Nigeria and Afghanistan in particular - would be attending.</p>
<h5>Who is going?</h5>
<p>Representatives from more than 40 nations will join business leaders, campaigners and a diverse range of anti-corruption experts at Lancaster House, London.</p>
<p>"Cameron has invited all 20 member states within the G20, including Russia, Brazil and South Africa – three countries mired in corruption allegations," says <a href="http://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/may/04/cameron-to-propose-global-anti-corruption-agency-at-summit" target="_blank">The Guardian</a>.</p>
<p>There will, however, be some notable absences. Despite the recent leak of millions of documents exposing the scale of offshore tax avoidance, Panama will not be sending delegates to the summit. "The British Virgin Islands has also been left off Downing Street's invitation list," says <a href="http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/david-camerons-anti-corruption-summit-2016-what-will-happen-and-why-is-it-going-to-be-extremely-a7023006.html" target="_blank">The Independent</a>.</p>
<p>As the global ramifications from the Panama Papers rumble on, the Prime Minister is coming under increasing pressure to crack down on UK-administered tax havens.</p>
<h5>What's on the agenda?</h5>
<p>No 10 says delegates will "commit to taking practical steps to tackle the problem and make it a genuine global priority" by signing the first ever global declaration against corruption.</p>
<p>As well as addressing issues of financial secrecy, one of the key proposals will be the establishment of an international anti-corruption body to assist law enforcement agencies in addressing money laundering and tax evasion.</p>
<p>The summit will also make a "big play" to start tackling the so-called facilitators of corruption, says Hough in the New Statesman. "The UK government is keen to force the lawyers and the accountants, the bankers and the estate agents to conduct due diligence on where money comes from."</p>
<h5>Will anything meaningful be agreed?</h5>
<p>There is a real danger that the summit will "turn out to be a hypocrites' ball, the dance floor crowded with kleptocrats posing as clean-up crusaders", says Roger Boyes, the diplomatic editor of <a href="http://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/miracle-required-to-rid-the-world-of-corruption-6pwm9gv73" target="_blank">The Times</a>.</p>
<p>"A conversation about corruption has to be both global and local," he adds. "It has to examine and expose networks of power and business, not just in Africa but in China, south-east Asia, Russia and, yes, in the City of London and New York too."</p>
<p>Hough also highlights the risk that the summit will simply declare that its agreements should be implemented, but with no obligation to do so. "International summitry is a world full of communiques that soon disappear down to the second or third pages of a Google search," he says. </p>
          </div>
      </div><div class="field field-name-field-category-secondary field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/politics">Politics</a></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-tags field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/corruption">corruption</a></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><a href="/david-cameron">David Cameron</a></div>      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/tags/nigeria">Nigeria</a></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><a href="/panama-papers-0">Panama Papers</a></div>    </div></div></description>

  <item>
    <title>Liverpool salvage a late draw as Chelsea stumble yet again</title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/premier-league/72529/liverpool-salvage-a-late-draw-as-chelsea-stumble-yet-again</link>
    <description><div class="primary-image">
      <div id="file-94776" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg file-default">
  
  
  <div class="content">    <img src="http://cdn1.theweek.co.uk/sites/theweek/files/styles/article_main_image/public/2016/05/160512-chelsea.jpg?itok=6R4Hw0kH" alt="Eden Hazard" title="Eden Hazard" /><div class="field field-name-field-file-credits field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Credits&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Paul Ellis/AFP/Getty</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-alt-text field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Alt Text&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Eden Hazard</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>  </div>
<p class="short-teaser">
Benteke equalises is stoppage time as the Blues are undone once again by their reliance on Hazard</p>
<span class="field field-name-field-article-type field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">
      <span class="field-item even"><a href="/match-report">Match Report</a></span>
  </span><div class="field field-name-field-published-date field-type-datetime field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Thursday, May 12, 2016 - 8:40am</span></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-body">
            <div class="field-item even">
        <p> <strong>Liverpool 1 Chelsea 1</strong></p>
<p>Not so long ago an end of season clash between two of the giants of English football would have set the pulses a racing. A title decider, perhaps, or at the very least a tussle for a place in the Champions League the following season.</p>
<p>But Wednesday night's showdown between Liverpool and Chelsea was a low-key affair. True, the Reds have got next week's Europa League final to look forward, but as far as the Premier League goes this season has been a write-off for both clubs.</p>
<p>The best that can be said about the 1-1 draw is that it keeps alive Liverpool's slim hopes of a top seven finish - and possible qualification for next season's Europa League should they lose to Sevilla in next week's final and miss out on the Champions League as a consequence.</p>
<p>Jurgen Klopp's side lie eighth, a point behind Southampton and three shy of West Ham, who are sixth ahead of Sunday's final round of matches. A win would have left the Reds in seventh, and in position to claim a European place if Man United win the FA Cup.</p>
<p>Chelsea's point keeps them in ninth, ten points behind Liverpool and a staggering 31 short of Leicester's tally of 80, and Wednesday's display summed up the Blues' season. Apart from the performance of Eden Hazard, who scored the opening goal of the game, there was little quality from the visitors.</p>
<p>Last season's PFA Player of the Year has had a poor season, but Hazard has come good at the end, and his first-half goal against Liverpool was his fourth in four matches. He also contributed with 96 touches in all, proof that the Belgian had rediscovered his appetite after a season in which rumours have linked him with a move away from Stamford Bridge.</p>
<p>But that also illustrated Chelsea's reliance on Hazard. Without him at his best they have been awful and when he has shown form he has carried the rest of the team.</p>
<p>Incoming manager Antonio Conte must ensure that Hazard remains at the club next season - and that he gets the best out of him - if the Blues are to once more become title contenders. "Hazard was terrific and has been growing in fitness for some weeks," said Guus Hiddink. "It's good to see. He had to suffer a lot with injuries this year but I'm very happy he's back."</p>
<p>Liverpool left it late for their equaliser, substitute Christian Benteke getting the goal in the second minute of stoppage time after Asmir Begovic, stepping in for the mysteriously incapacitated Thibaut Courtois, made a hash of a cross.</p>
<p>Afterwards manager Jurgen Klopp admitted it hadn't been the best display from his side. "We lost patience, we lost formation," he said, in what was his 50th match in charge of the Reds. "We had a lot of moments around the box when we shot when we should have passed."</p>
<p>But the German added that the game was more useful in terms of preparation for next week showdown with Sevilla. "The result wasn't important," he said. "That we take the right information out of this game, that's important." </p>
          </div>
      </div><div class="field field-name-field-tags field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/tags/eden-hazard">Eden Hazard</a></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><a href="/tags/christian-benteke">Christian Benteke</a></div>      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/tags/asmir-begovic">Asmir Begovic</a></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><a href="/tags/chelsea">Chelsea</a></div>      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/liverpool-fc">Liverpool FC</a></div>    </div></div></description>

  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Culture Secretary John Whittingdale has told the BBC to concentrate on &quot;distinctive content&quot; that &quot;enshrines&quot; diversity, in a white paper that preserves the licence fee for at least another 11 years. It calls for the corporation to be governed by a unitary board, which will replace the BBC Trust, with output to be regulated by Ofcom.</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-reference field-type-node-reference field-label-hidden">

  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">David Cameron is introducing a new corporate offence for executives who fail to prevent fraud or money laundering within their companies. Writing in The Guardian ahead of an anti-corruption summit, the PM says he also plans to force all foreign companies buying property in the UK to disclose their true owners in a public register for the first time.</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-reference field-type-node-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/72530/anti-corruption-summit-who-is-going-and-whats-on-the-agenda">Anti-corruption summit: Who is going and what&#039;s on the agenda</a></div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-stories/23495" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Bank of England issues Brexit recession warning </div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">The Bank of England&#039;s Monetary Policy Committee has warned that leaving the EU could damage the economy, cause the pound to fall and unemployment to rise. Governor Mark Carney said the results could include &quot;a technical recession&quot; - two quarters of negtive growth. The bank&#039;s forecast predicted inflation would reach 0.9% in September if the UK stayed in the EU.</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-reference field-type-node-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/eu-referendum/65461/eu-referendum-poll-will-scotland-swing-the-vote">EU referendum poll: Will Scotland swing the vote?</a></div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-stories/23488" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Two fragments &#039;almost certainly&#039; from MH370</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Two aircraft fragments washed up on beaches in South Africa and Mauritius earlier this year are &quot;almost certainly&quot; from the wreckage of the missing Malaysia Airlines flight MH370, Australian investigators say. The news brings the number of pieces found around the Indian Ocean to five.</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-stories/23490" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">US Muslim ban is &#039;only a suggestion&#039;, says Trump</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Donald Trump appears to be backtracking on his campaign proposal to ban Muslims from entering the US, after London mayor Sadiq Khan rejected the property dealer&#039;s offer to make an exception for him. Trump said: &quot;It&#039;s a temporary ban. It hasn&#039;t been called for yet. This is just a suggestion until we find out what&#039;s going on.&quot;</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-stories/23491" typeof="">

  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">A US soldier competing at the Invictus Games has donated her gold medal to Papworth Hospital in Cambridgeshire. Elizabeth Marks, who won four swimming golds, asked Prince Harry to present one of the medals to the hospital to thank them for saving her life after she fell seriously ill at the first games for injured service personnel two years ago. 
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-stories/23492" typeof="">

  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">One in four pregnancies worldwide ends in abortion, according to estimates from the World Health Organisation and the Guttmacher Institute in the US. Researchers say 56 million terminations take place annually, more than previously thought and up from 50 million 20 years ago. The rise is occurring most in the developing world.</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-reference field-type-node-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/72536/one-in-four-pregnancies-ends-in-abortion-say-new-global-estimates">One in four pregnancies ends in abortion, say new global estimates</a></div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>

  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">George Zimmerman is to auction the gun he used to shoot dead unarmed African-American Trayvon Martin in 2012. The Kel-Tec PF-9 9mm is listed on Gunbroker.com as &quot;your chance to own a piece of American history&quot;, with a starting price of $5,000 (£3,464). Zimmerman was cleared over the death.</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-stories/23494" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Charnley &#039;devastated&#039; at Newcastle United&#039;s relegation</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Newcastle United managing director Lee Charnley says he is &quot;devastated&quot; the club have been relegated from the Premier League. &quot;I am truly sorry we have not given you the outcome you deserve,&quot; he told fans. The Magpies&#039; fate was sealed by Sunderland&#039;s 3-0 victory at home against Everton. The result sent Newcastle and Norwich down alongside Aston Villa </div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-reference field-type-node-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/newcastle-united/72547/can-rafa-benitez-save-newcastle-united-from-toxic-owners">Can Rafa Benitez save Newcastle United from &#039;toxic&#039; owners? </a></div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-stories clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-stories/23496" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-story-headline field-type-text field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Briefing: Who will take part in the EU referendum debates?</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">A series of televised debates are planned for the final days of the EU referendum campaign, with both sides going head-to-head in a last ditch attempt to sway undecided voters. The BBC will stage three separate debates featuring key campaigners from the Leave and Remain camps in front of live studio audiences - but David Cameron has ruled himself out, and insisted there should be no messy blue-on-blue fighting on display.</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-story-reference field-type-node-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/eu-referendum/72458/eu-referendum-tv-debates-who-will-take-part">EU referendum TV debates: What&#039;s happening and who will take part?</a></div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>    </div></div></div></description>

  <item>
    <title>Thursday May 12 2016</title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/am/thursday-may-12-2016</link>
    <description><p class="short-teaser">
Company news, markets and financial talking points, available from 8am Monday to Friday</p>
<div class="field-collection-container clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-items field-type-field-collection field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-items clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-items/23480" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-item-title field-type-text field-label-hidden">Cameron vows anti-corruption property clampdown </div><div class="field field-name-field-item-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> Overseas companies owning or buying property in the UK will be forced to reveal who really owns them under new plans announced by David Cameron. In a bid to crack down on money laundering, any foreign company buying property or bidding for government contracts will have to sign up to a new public register before the deal can be finalised.  </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-items clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-items/23481" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-item-title field-type-text field-label-hidden">Tesco's Dave Lewis 'to be handed £3m bonus'</div><div class="field field-name-field-item-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> Tesco boss Dave Lewis has been awarded an annual bonus of nearly £3m as the retail giant moves back into profit after notching up the biggest loss in its history a year ago. Sky News claims the grocer will reveal the bonus in its annual report tomorrow, alongside a £185m pot to be shared out among the company's 265,000 UK employees. </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-items clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-items/23482" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-item-title field-type-text field-label-hidden">Adidas blows the whistle on Chelsea sponsorship</div><div class="field field-name-field-item-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> Adidas is ending its sponsorship of English football club Chelsea six years early. The German sportswear firm, which has sponsored the Stamford Bridge club since 2006, said it had reached a mutual agreement to end the deal on 30 June 2017, instead of 2023. The club will have to pay Adidas tens of millions of euros in compensation, which has allowed the sportswear maker to up its profit forecast for the third time in three months. Adidas's profits are now expected to rise 25% this year. </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-items clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-items/23483" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-item-title field-type-text field-label-hidden">Philip Green challenges regulator's evidence </div><div class="field field-name-field-item-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> Sir Philip Green is fighting back against claims from the Pension Regulator. The controversial tycoon wrote to MPs to contradict the evidence of Lesley Titcomb, saying the watchdog was given notice of a possible sale of BHS as early as July 2014 and was given concrete guidance in February 2015. </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-items clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-items/23484" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-item-title field-type-text field-label-hidden">Quote of the day… Loan group slams Google ban </div><div class="field field-name-field-item-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> "It's disappointing that a site created to help give users full access to information is making arbitrary choices on the advertisements users are allowed to see from legal businesses." Lisa McGreevy, the president of the Online Lenders Association, on Google's plans to <a href="http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-36272031" target="_blank">ban ads</a> from payday lenders. </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-items clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-items/23485" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-item-title field-type-text field-label-hidden">Bookies hope for 'Leicester effect' boost next season</div><div class="field field-name-field-item-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> Bookmaker William Hill has dished out £3m to gamblers who backed Leicester City to win the Premier League, but enjoyed good takings from the rest of the season's matches. A spokesman said the company hopes the Foxes' unexpected success will lead to a betting boom on underdog teams next season. "I would expect the market for next season to be bulging," chief executive James Henderson told Bloomberg. </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>      <div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-full field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-items clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-items/23486" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-item-title field-type-text field-label-hidden">THE NUMBERS... AT 0730 GMT</div><div class="field field-name-field-item-body field-type-text-long field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> FTSE 100: up +0.09 to 6162.49<br />
Dow Jones: down -1.21 to 17711.12<br />
Dax: down -0.70 to 9975.32<br />
Cac 40: down -0.50 to 4316.67<br />
Nikkei: up +0.19 to 16611.26<br />
Hang Seng: down -0.33 to 19989.79<br />
US dollar: buys €0.87540 and £0.69260<br />
Sterling: buys $1.44380 and €1.26410<br />
Oil: $47.39 up +4.1 </p>
</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div>    </div></div></div></description>

  <item>
    <title>Luke Shaw and David de Gea launch blue Man Utd away kit</title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/football-kits/72512/luke-shaw-and-david-de-gea-launch-blue-man-utd-away-kit</link>
    <description><div class="primary-image">
      <div id="file-94761" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg file-default">
  
  
  <div class="content">    <img src="http://cdn1.theweek.co.uk/sites/theweek/files/styles/article_main_image/public/2016/05/160511_man_utd_kit.jpg?itok=d1zmoZdF" alt="Manchester United kit" title="Manchester United kit" /><div class="field field-name-field-file-credits field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Credits&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Adidas/Man United</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-alt-text field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Alt Text&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Manchester United kit</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>  </div>
<p class="short-teaser">
Spanish goalkeeper dons &#039;zesty lime&#039; top alongside team-mates in blue but does not look overjoyed at wearing it</p>
<span class="field field-name-field-article-type field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">
      <span class="field-item even"><a href="/one-minute-read">One-Minute Read</a></span>
  </span><div class="field field-name-field-published-date field-type-datetime field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Wednesday, May 11, 2016 - 4:21pm</span></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-body">
            <div class="field-item even">
        <p> Manchester United have launched a new blue away kit for next season, with goalkeeper David de Gea among those modelling the strip, raising hopes that he will still be with the club next season.</p>
<p>The team currently have a white away kit and last wore blue when it was their third kit during the the 2014-15 campaign.</p>
<p>The "collegiate blue marl" tops have red Adidas stripes and a red Manchester United crest. Chevrolet remains the sponsor. They will go on sale at £60 for a short-sleeved men's shirt. The women's and child's versions are slightly cheaper at £50, but long sleeves add £5 to the price. The "authentic" version of the kit as worn by the players costs £90, says the <a href="http://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/manchester-united-reveal-away-kit-7943256" target="_blank">Daily Mirror</a>.</p>
<p>The shorts and socks are also blue with red detail.</p>
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-lang="en"><p lang="en" dir="ltr">Introducing the new United away shirt for 2016/17. Available now: <a href="https://t.co/EOIypkOm5W">https://t.co/EOIypkOm5W</a> <a href="https://t.co/4S74FfOJgL">pic.twitter.com/4S74FfOJgL</a></p>
<p>&mdash; Manchester United (@ManUtd) <a href="https://twitter.com/ManUtd/status/730306477769035776">May 11, 2016</a></p></blockquote>
<script async src="//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script><p>
"A cursory examination reveals that the general social media response has been less than complimentary since the shirt was first leaked last week, with many fans pointing out that it bears a striking resemblance to the training gear United have been sporting this year," notes <a href="http://www.espnfc.com/blog/the-toe-poke/65/post/2869244/manchester-united-reveal-new-away-kit" target="_blank">ESPN</a>.</p>
<p>As ever there was intense scrutiny of the launch. "Of more interest is that de Gea is included in the imagery to promote the new jersey – although he cuts a moody figure in the photoshoot," says <a href="http://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/manchester-united-away-kit-revealed-moody-david-de-gea-features-in-promotional-picture-a7023726.html" target="_blank">The Independent</a>. "The Spaniard has been strongly linked with a summer move to Real Madrid after a deal for his transfer to the Bernabeu last August only fell through due to a paperwork error."</p>
<p>However, the keeper, whose top is a "zesty lime" colour according to ESPN looks far from happy about proceedings. The other players modelling the kit are Ashley Young, Juan Mata and Luke Shaw, who is on the verge of returning from a double broken leg.</p>
<p>Next year's home kit has yet to be released but rumoured designs have been circulating on social media for weeks. </p>
          </div>
      </div><div class="field field-name-field-tags field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/tags/manchester-united">Manchester United</a></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><a href="/lke-shaw">Lke Shaw</a></div>      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/tags/david-de-gea">David De Gea</a></div>    </div></div></description>
     <pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 15:19:44 +0000</pubDate>
 <dc:creator>hollie</dc:creator>
 <guid isPermaLink="false">72512 at http://www.theweek.co.uk</guid>
 <category domain="http://www.theweek.co.uk/football">Football</category>
 <enclosure url="http://cdn1.theweek.co.uk/sites/theweek/files/2016/05/160511_man_utd_kit.jpg" length="806982" type="image/jpeg" />
  </item>
  <item>
    <title>Budweiser rebrands to 'America' until end of elections</title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/72511/budweiser-rebrands-to-america-until-end-of-elections</link>
    <description><div class="primary-image">
      <div id="file-94758" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg file-default">
  
  
  <div class="content">    <img src="http://cdn2.theweek.co.uk/sites/theweek/files/styles/article_main_image/public/2016/05/stlouis_brewery_02.jpg?itok=88YHKoul" alt="Budweiser " title="Budweiser " /><div class="field field-name-field-file-alt-text field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Alt Text&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Budweiser </div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>  </div>
<p class="short-teaser">
Marketing ploy plans to cash in on sporting events and patriotic public holidays</p>
<span class="field field-name-field-article-type field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">
      <span class="field-item even"><a href="/one-minute-read">One-Minute Read</a></span>
  </span><div class="field field-name-field-published-date field-type-datetime field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Wednesday, May 11, 2016 - 4:06pm</span></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-body">
            <div class="field-item even">
        <p> "Brazilian-run, Belgium-based… Anheuser-Busch InBev has redesigned its labels" in the US, reports the <a href="http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-36260352" target="_blank">BBC</a>. The company has temporarily rebranding its flagship beer Budweiser as - America.</p>
<p>It might sound strange, but "placing aside matters of taste, there's no legal problem with naming something 'America' that isn't America", notes Jessica Roy in the <a href="http://www.latimes.com/business/la-fi-budweiser-america-trademark-20160510-snap-htmlstory.html" target="_blank">Los Angeles Times</a>. The marketing ploy will last until the end of the presidential election season on 8 November.</p>
<p>"We are embarking on what should be the most patriotic summer that this generation has ever seen," said a company spokesperson, citing the hosting of the Copa America football tournament as well as the summer Olympic Games in Brazil and the usual public holidays, including the ultra-patriotic 4 July independence day.</p>
<p>And, of course, there's the small matter of selecting a new leader of the free world, during the campaigning for which the candidates, probably Hilary Clinton and Donald Trump, will spend a lot of time talking about how great America is – or could be.</p>
<p>Not everyone is a fan of the plans. Writing in the <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/posteverything/wp/2016/05/11/why-budweiser-is-the-last-beer-that-should-call-itself-america/%20%20%20" target="_blank">Washington Post</a>, Tom Acitelli says that while "from a marketing standpoint" the plan is "freakishly brilliant, however shameless", if you "peel back the label a bit… it all tastes a bit thin.</p>
<p>"Why? Because Budweiser is about as American these days as a successful Green Party or ample paid maternity leave," he rails. "Not because it's foreign-controlled - lots of firms operating in the US market are. What really disqualifies AB-InBev is the relentless mass-production of its beers, that flagship Budweiser in particular. Watery, soda-pop fizzy and ruthlessly inoffensive."</p>
<p>But many expect the plans will boost sales of what is already by far the US's favourite beer.</p>
<p>"Will American consumers be fooled into thinking they're drinking liquid patriotism? Maybe," adds Roy in the LA Times. "So-called consumer patriotism appears to spike around international sporting events… And let's be honest: it's going to be tough to resist the allure of Instagramming yourself cracking open a can of 'America' at your Fourth of July party." </p>
          </div>
      </div><div class="field field-name-field-category-secondary field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/world-business">World business</a></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-tags field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/budweiser">Budweiser</a></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><a href="/america">America</a></div>    </div></div></description>
     <pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 15:09:13 +0000</pubDate>
 <dc:creator>Jamie Timson</dc:creator>

  </item>
  <item>
    <title>Surrey woman rugby-tackles Brad Pitt the runaway llama </title>
    <link>http://www.theweek.co.uk/72509/surrey-woman-rugby-tackles-brad-pitt-the-runaway-llama</link>
    <description><div class="primary-image">
      <div id="file-94756" class="file file-image file-image-jpeg file-default">
  
  
  <div class="content">    <img src="http://cdn1.theweek.co.uk/sites/theweek/files/styles/article_main_image/public/2016/05/160511-llama.jpg?itok=UPKb0LmN" alt="Llama" title="Llama" /><div class="field field-name-field-file-description field-type-text-long field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Description&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><p> This is not a photo of 'Brad Pitt' </p>
</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-credits field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Credits&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Matt Cardy/Getty</div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-file-alt-text field-type-text field-label-above">      <div class="field-label">Alt Text&nbsp;</div>
  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even">Llama</div>    </div></div>  </div>
</div>  </div>
<p class="short-teaser">
Horse expert called into action after animal leaves girlfriends Thelma and Louise and goes on the run</p>
<span class="field field-name-field-article-type field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">
      <span class="field-item even"><a href="/one-minute-read">One-Minute Read</a></span>
  </span><div class="field field-name-field-published-date field-type-datetime field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">Wednesday, May 11, 2016 - 3:56pm</span></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-body">
            <div class="field-item even">
        <p> A llama called Brad Pitt had to be rugby-tackled to the ground after he left his girlfriends Thelma and Louise and rampaged through a sleepy Surrey village.</p>
<p>Alex Gache, the owner of an equestrian centre, leapt into action when she received a call from a panicked friend who had been cornered by the South American pack animal on Saturday night in the village of Woodhatch.</p>
<p>Explaining the bizarre series of events, Gache told the <a href="http://www.getsurrey.co.uk/news/surrey-news/brad-pitt-llama-reunited-owner-11309073" target="_blank">Surrey Advertiser</a> that the police had called her about the animal earlier that evening: "The first I knew about it, the police stopped in at my equestrian centre at 6pm to ask if it was mine. I do own llamas but I said 'No, all mine are here' and they said they had managed to corner it in a field along the A217."</p>
<p>But the llama drama continued after Brad Pitt managed to escape. Gache was called by a friend at around 8pm, who said: "Help, I have a llama in my garden, what do I do?"</p>
<p>The llama returned to the A217, jumping into the road and back again into gardens, with the chase lasting until 11.30pm when Gache finally "rugby-tackled" him and took him back to her stables, reports <a href="http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/news/7139901/Sound-the-a-llama-South-American-pack-animal-called-Brad-Pitt-goes-on-the-run-through-Surrey-village-after-escaping-from-his-field.html" target="_blank">The Sun</a>. "He just seemed quite terrified of people," she explained.</p>
<p>The owner of the llama, who was on holiday at the time, said Brad lived with his two girlfriends Thelma and Louise.</p>
<p>While on his travels, Brad had been spotted by village locals, a number of whom reported to the police sightings of a "big dog".</p>
<p>One such local, Jack Read, even managed to snap a picture of the woolly-haired beast as it made its way through the village.</p>
<p>"I looked up and I thought it was a big dog, but then I realised what it was, this big white woolly thing," he said. "It was on its own just exploring just round the corner from where I live." </p>
          </div>
      </div><div class="field field-name-field-category-secondary field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/people">People</a></div>    </div></div><div class="field field-name-field-tags field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden">  
  <div class="field-items">      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/llama">Llama</a></div>      <div class="field-item odd"><a href="/tags/brad-pitt">Brad Pitt</a></div>      <div class="field-item even"><a href="/surrey">Surrey</a></div>    </div></div></description>
     <pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 15:01:17 +0000</pubDate>
 <dc:creator>Jamie Timson</dc:creator>
